page.title: 01MURTON IN 1985
page.content: MURTON lies in the North East corner of County Durham. It is basically divided into two sections- 1. the area around the coal mine,which comprises mainly council houses,the main shopping street,banks,post office,optician,dentists and doctors surgeries and 2. The "village" which has a village green, some modern council houses, many private houses, farms and two riding schools.There is a full Olympic sized open-air swimming pool with the water heated from the coal mine. Murton has football fields a cricket pitch and a large park in which there are tennis courts,bowling green and picnic and children's play areas.To the East of Murton lies the coast with fine beaches, and to the West farmland and country-side leading to the beautiful city of Durham.
